administration/server_configuration.title: Server configuration
administration/server_configuration.description: Most configuration sits in the database, only a few parameters are stored as environment variables.

administration/templates.title: Templates
administration/templates.description: Templates are a way to centralise and to define a text or a document with placeholders usable by workflows and some features of the APIO core.

administration/webhooks.title: Webhooks
administration/webhooks.description: Some requests processed by APIO core can trigger webhooks. A webhook is a HTTP request sent to a specific URL. The URL is configured in the Webhooks section of the settings menu.

auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: APIO core supports multiple authentication mechanisms. You can use them to authenticate your users and to authenticate your API calls.

configuration/alarms.title: Alarms
configuration/alarms.description: APIO core can send alarms reports with emails.

configuration/cache.title: Cache
configuration/cache.description: APIO core nodes can use a Redis server or its internal memory to cache some data.

configuration/cleanup.title: Cleanup
configuration/cleanup.description: APIO core can cleanup the history data in the database automatically.

configuration/data stores.title: Data stores
configuration/data stores.description: APIO core supports multiple data stores. You can use them to interract with external databases directly from workflows.

configuration/env.title: Environment variables
configuration/env.description: APIO core can be configured with environment variables.

configuration/gateways.title: HTTP clients (a.k.a Gateways)
configuration/gateways.description: APIO core engine can keep client sessions with multiple servers. Each client is identified by a unique name. The session_holder name is used to identify the client in the HTTP calls nodes (e.g HTTP call node).

configuration/gui.title: Gui
configuration/gui.description: The APIO core comes with a GUI that allows you to manage the APIO core. This GUI may hide/expose some features of the APIO core.

configuration/licenses.title: License
configuration/licenses.description: APIO core has a proprietary license. License are delivered by Netaxis support team and are valid for a specific period of time.

configuration/password.title: Password
configuration/password.description: Password rules for APIO core users can be configured here.

configuration/provisioning.title: Provisioning
configuration/provisioning.description: When APIO core is integrated with Broadsoft (gateway(s)), it may be used to provision the Broadsoft platform via a Provisioning ui.

configuration/smpp.title: SMPP
configuration/smpp.description: APIO core engine can use an SMPP server to send sms from workflows.

configuration/smtp.title: SMTP
configuration/smtp.description: APIO core engine can use an SMTP server to send emails either from workflows or from internal processes (e.g. Two-Factor Authentication, reset password, etc...).

configuration/sso.title: SSO
configuration/sso.description: APIO core supports SSO (Single Sign-On) via a bunch of protocols.

configuration/tcp.title: TCP
configuration/tcp.description: Aside of HTTP clients, APIO core also supports a bunch of other protocols on top of TCP.

history/requests.title: Requests
history/requests.description: Every request sent to APIO core is logged in the database. So a user can see the history of the requests. Search for activities or issues and see the details of each request.

intro.title: Welcome to APIO core engine
intro.description: APIO core is a simple workflow engine with great extensibility.

migrations.title: Migrations
migrations.description: Some versions need some changes to the server configuration or the database.

triggers/bulk.title: Bulks
triggers/bulk.description: Bulk jobs are a way to run a workflow on a set of data. For example, you might want to send an email to all users who signed up in the last week. You can do this by creating a bulk job that runs a job on all users who signed up in the last week.

triggers/custom_routes.title: Custom routes
triggers/custom_routes.description: APIO core supports custom HTTP routes. You can use them to expose your workflows to create your own API calls.

triggers/scheduled_jobs.title: Scheduled jobs
triggers/scheduled_jobs.description: A scheduled job is a job that is executed periodically. It is used to execute a task periodically. (e.g reporting, data synchronization, etc.)

workflows/advanced/entities.title: Entities
workflows/advanced/entities.description: Entities are special nodes that can be used to represent an external process or system which is not managed by APIO but which can interract with the workflow.

workflows/advanced/manual_actions.title: Manual actions
workflows/advanced/manual_actions.description: Manual actions are used to pause the workflow and wait for a user to perform an action.

workflows/advanced/versioning.title: Versions
workflows/advanced/versioning.description: It can be useful to keep track of the different versions of a workflow. For example, you might want to keep a version of a workflow that is currently in production or which you are certain it is working, and a version that is being tested.

workflows/nodes.title: Nodes
workflows/nodes.description: Nodes are the building blocks of a workflow (a.k.a cells).

workflows/templates.title: Templates
workflows/templates.description: Most fields in the nodes can be evaluated as templates. The template engine is Jinja2 and expose all the buit-in's of the language.
